title: Dereck Chisora stops David Price in round four after towel is thrown in during fight

Dereck Chisora stopped David Price in the fourth round of their heavyweight clash at London's O2.

Price's trainer threw in the towel after the Liverpudlian was dropped following a brutal combination from Chisora.

Price clambered back to his feet from the canvas after beating the count but trainer Joe McNally had seen enough and ended the fight.

Chisora was the aggressor from the off against former WBO world champion Parker as the London crowd got behind their man.

The 35-year-old went to work on the body of his taller opponent, and received an early warning from the referee about low blows.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

(Image: PA)

Price did his best to counter Chisora with his jab, but the tenacious Londoner dominated the ring in the opening two rounds and advanced forward relentlessly.

Price let his hands go in the third, and caught Chisora with a combination.

But the Londoner was quick to tie up the bigger man, catching him with a brutal left hook to the jaw midway through the round.

By the end of the third Price was holding on as Chisora let his hands go, with the duo staring each other down on the bell.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

And in the fourth Chisora finished the job with a combination that floored Price.

The pair were boxing on the undercard of Regis Prograis' fight with Josh Taylor for the Muhammad Ali Trophy in the World Boxing Super Series.
description: Price's trainer threw the towel in to end the fight after the Liverpudlian was dropped by Dereck Chisora
